job_description:
• US citizen or green card holder: This internship requires access to documentation that is controlled by the export laws of the United States.
• Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8USC 1324b(a)(3).
• Quality Certification: Support compliance with AS9100 standards and maintain MIL-PRF-19500 and MIL-PRF-38535 certifications Writing Ability: Strong writing and analytical skills for professional documentation and problem resolution Electronic Component Knowledge: Knowledge of or experience with identifying electronic components is a plus Component Identification: Enhance expertise in identifying electronic components for quality applications Education: Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Materials, or Electrical Engineering Certifications: Experience or understanding of AS9100 and related quality certifications preferred Communication Skills: Proficient in interacting with stakeholders across various departments Problem-Solving Tools: Familiarity with the 8D method is preferred GPA: Minimum current GPA of 3.
